text: Uraj is a former independent village in Borsod-Abaúj-Zemplén County. It has been part of Ózd since 1978. == Location == It is in the Uraj stream valley, 3.2 km northwest of Ózd, near the Hungary-Slovakia border. Its northwestern neighbor is Susa, 3 km away. == History == The name of the village was Wray in 1216, Vraj in 1360, and Wraja in 1427. After the Turkish destruction, people left, but later they came back. The Roman Catholic church was built in 15th century. Since 1978, it has been part of the city of Ózd. == Notes == Category:Villages in Hungary Category:Settlements in Borsod-Abaúj-Zemplén County Category:Ózd
title: Uraj
